locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explores the conditionality of the 'if' in Revelation 3:20, using the metaphor of Holman Hunt's painting to emphasize human responsibility and the subsequent promise of communion.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. Focuses on the metaphor of the door and the 'if' as a risk/choice rather than a deep textual exegesis of the Laodicean context.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from describing a painting (Assertive) to warning about the risk of choice (Directive) and finally to a dialogue of exchange (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: I would have our emphasis to fall on this great if
Christ knocks
I will come in

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To make the hearer 'tremble' at their power of choice and ultimately to move them to 'open the door' to Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The focus is heavily on the human 'will' and 'energy' to open the door.

voorbeelden: The Lord Jesus stands in the painting
There is a great 'if' in our lives
This will not be the first time I have faced you
mark those last words
Watch out for need
Don't dismiss with some smart-aleck remark
I pray
I hope
I wonder if we have allowed...
I will come in to him
I will give you my holiness
I will take what you have
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong toward the end, though often framed as a quote of Jesus rather than a direct apostolic 'I promise you'.

voorbeelden: I will open the door!
Come in, Lord Jesus
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher describes the declaration rather than performing a sacramental act like absolution.

indicatoren: Extensive description of Holman Hunt's painting
Generalizing about the nature of 'risk' in TV dramas and government
Talking about the text's history in the congregation
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a 'splendid' text rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct sacramental address (e.g., 'Today, Christ is knocking at *your* door')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is told they *should* open the door, but the sermon itself doesn't always function as the knock.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality in the final 'dialogue' section where Christ's promises are voiced.
voorbeelden: I will give you my holiness and my righteousness

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's intentions ('I would have', 'I daresay') and the 'I' of Christ in the dialogue.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Addressing the congregation's habits and their 'power of choice'.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used mostly in directives ('You must', 'Watch out').

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the painting, the text, and 'men and women' in general.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the first half.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: History of the text and the painting's creation.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about life, risk, and 'if'.

actueel_present.gebruik: The final dialogue where Christ speaks now.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (description of risk) -> Directive (you ought to tremble/open).
voorbeelden: This element of risk... ought to make you tremble in those pews.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Places the burden of the 'event' entirely on the hearer's willpower.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The final section moves from the Assertive (Christ's word) to the Commissive (I will give you my holiness).
voorbeelden: He says, 'Good, give me that... I will give you my holiness.'
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: This is the most performative and 'sacramental' part of the sermon.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: I will take what you have, and I will give you what I have.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: How sad if we let anything... shut out the sound.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: While the ending is comforting, the bulk of the sermon focuses on the 'great if' as a human capacity and risk, making the 'event' dependent on human 'energy' and 'will'.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I will give you my holiness and my righteousness.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides the actual 'Toezegging' (Promise) that faith can rest upon.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long description of Holman Hunt's painting and TV dramas.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the encounter with the living Word through secondary illustrations.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event only in the final third. The first two-thirds are 'talking about' the text and the concept of choice.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts more as a motivator of the will than a distributor of grace until the very end.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is quoted, but the preacher speaks mostly as an observer of the text.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. The preacher says 'I have no desire to speak to either...', focusing on his own homiletical strategy.
tekstueel_bewijs: This morning will not be the first time I have tried to hold up this text

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is attributed to the hearer's 'will' and 'energy' rather than the Spirit.
tekstueel_bewijs: if you have the spiritual sensitivity to hear and the energy, the will to open the door

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Only at the end when the 'exchange' is proclaimed.
tekstueel_bewijs: I am that balm in Gilead to cure a sinsick soul.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many descriptive verbs (stands, is, shows) and moralistic directives (ought, must, don't). Needs more commissives (I promise) and declaratives (You are forgiven).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The right hand is knocking. It is the picture of a wanting and waiting Lord.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Even now, Christ is knocking at the door of your life. He is here, waiting for you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from describing a picture to a present-tense encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is conditional on the 'if' of human will.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He has died for you, He now promises to enter.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'men and women' (3rd person).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' more directly in the context of grace.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ is not just knocking at 'the human heart', He is knocking at *your* heart today.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative (Open the door!) precedes the full weight of the indicative (Christ has already come to you).
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Start with the beauty of Christ's arrival before demanding the opening of the door.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a beautiful ending that approaches a sacramental event, but it spends too much time in the 'gallery' looking at paintings before entering the 'throne room' of the promise.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his love for the text; SAT reveals that the preacher's primary failure is not psychological but illocutionary (failing to perform the promise).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Light of the World' illustration; SAT critiques it for being a constative detour that delays the performative 'knock' of the sermon.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'if' is treated as a constative condition rather than a performative invitation, shifting the weight from God's act to the hearer's effort.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: That door has no handle on the outside. It opens only from within.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High rhetorically, but low performatively as it reinforces human autonomy.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Toezegging' (Promise) at the very end to save it from being a purely moralistic lecture on 'choice'.
